p: A substantial diversity in CHDP exists across a number of other species that possess activity against human pathogens. The Antimicrobial Peptide Database ( http://aps.unmc.edu/AP) now contains in excess of 2,500 peptides with demonstrable antimicrobial activity isolated from six kingdoms, and includes peptides from bacteria, fungi, plant, amphibians, fish, reptiles and birds. Interestingly, approximately 170 of these peptides (which include cathelicidins and defensins) demonstrate antiviral activity against a broad range of viral pathogens.
